greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n, k) = 2*A132749(n, k) - 1, read by rows.
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 0..100 of the triangle, flattened
formula: T(n, k) = 2*A132749(n, k) - 1, an infinite lower triangular matrix.
example: First few rows of the triangle are:
program: def A132752(n,k): return 1 if k==n else 3 if k==0 else 2*binomial(n,k) -1
flatten([[A132752(n,k) for k in [0..n]] for n in [0..12]]) # _G. C. Greubel_, Feb 16 2021
A132752:= func< n,k | k eq n select 1 else k eq 0 select 3 else 2*Binomial(n,k) -1 >;
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Aug 28 2007
